hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Selloff
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a sharp 5%+ intraday drop on negative macro news (US budget crisis, regulatory headlines) but funding rates remain neutral/positive and perpetual open interest declines <10%, price will mean-revert 70% of the drop within 48 hours as spot liquidity returns.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Recent 'structural shift' narrative suggests liquidity providers are quick to return after non-fundamental selloffs. October's liquidity crash created PTSD-like behavior where market makers aggressively recapture spreads after panic selling. Negative funding during selloffs indicates excessive leverage flush, while neutral funding suggests organic spot selling that's more likely to reverse.
entry_conditions: BTC 4h close >5% below previous day's close
Aggregated funding rate across top 5 exchanges >-0.005% (not excessively negative)
Perpetual open interest decline <10% from 24h prior
Cumulative volume delta (CVD) shows selling exhaustion (last 2h CVD slope >0)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 70% retracement of the initial 5%+ drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new 24h low after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >50% of such events lead to continuation downward (new lows within 48h) across 20+ instances in backtest.
